interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Still Mine
Review Date: 2015/01/21
Store: James Cromwell  (Actor),     Genevieve Bujold  (Actor)    Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles
Product Description: ['In his first lead role after decades of playing supporting characters, James Cromwell gives a tour de force performance in STILL MINE, an exquisitely crafted and deeply affecting love story about a couple in their twilight years. Based on true events and laced with wry humor, STILL MINE tells the heartfelt tale of Craig Morrison (Academy Award(R) nominee Cromwell), who comes up against the system when he sets out to build a more suitable house for his ailing wife Irene (Academy Award(R) nominee Genevieve Bujold). Although Morrison uses the same methods his father, an accomplished shipbuilder, taught him, times have changed. He quickly gets blindsided by local building codes and bureaucratic officials. As Irene becomes increasingly ill - and amidst a series of stop-work orders - Craig races to finish the house. Hauled into court and facing jail, Craig takes a final stance against all odds in a truly inspirational story.']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'FOX2294981DVD', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Multiple Formats, Dolby, NTSC, Color, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 43 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 6, 2014', 'Actors': 'James Cromwell, Genevieve Bujold, Campbell Scott, Still Mine', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, English', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Number of discs': '1'}

["When a lonely ex-New Yorker moves into the home of a rural senior to act as a hospice worker, the two initially couldn't seem to be less alike. However, as time passes, the two find much kinship including a lost child. Slowly the two build a bond and learn about life."]

Lost in the Barrens
Nicholas Shields  (Actor),     Evan Adams  (Actor),     Michael J.F. Scott  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Kids & Family
['"Your strength and your courage will be shown in the good works that you do for others." When the trust fund keeping orphaned Jamie in his upper-class boarding school runs out, he must cross the continent to live with his Uncle Angus, a fur trapper, in the Canadian wilderness. Disobeying his father, Awasis, a native boy, and Jamie explore the breathtaking territory on their own. A careless accident makes the unlikely pair realize that their disobedience could cost them their lives. A loyal friendship is sparked as they begin to their vast cultural differences in a different light. But will that light burn brightly enough to lead them safely home?']

['(2009) Marvin Mobley dreams of becoming a great baseball player but no matter how much he practices or how hard he tries, he doesn’t improve. His dream finally comes true when he finds a mysterious pair of glasses that turns him into the greatest baseball player his town has ever seen. After the glasses disappear, Marvin doesn’t believe he can play but with the support of his team he learns that winning doesn’t mean anything if you can’t be proud of how you play the game.']

Legend of the Viking Cross Dvd! Feature Film for Families
Format: Unknown Binding
Movies & TV, Movies
['"If your brother needs you, you can\'t refuse him," Angeline tells Awasis, urging him to help their friend, Jamie, who has embarked on a dangerous journey. However, Jamie is guiding a treasure hunter named Connolly to a place Awasis never wants to see again -- the Viking grave. Connolly is nothing but a grave robber as far as Awasis is concerned. That\'s why he didn\'t hire on as one of Connolly\'s guides. Unfortunately, the lure of fame and fortune proves irresistible to Jamie. He is soon caught up in the hunt for a jewel-laden cross made of white gold, supposedly buried in the ancient Viking crypt. Jamie realizes too late that the cost of his perilous adventure may be far too high. If Jamie is to survive, Awasis must overcome his hurt feelings and team up with Angeline to rescue their "brother."']

Based on true events and laced with wry humor, STILL MINE tells the heartfelt tale of Craig Morrison (Academy Award(R) nominee Cromwell), who comes up against the system when he sets out to build a more suitable house for his ailing wife Irene (Academy Award(R) nominee Genevieve Bujold). Although Morrison uses the same methods his father, an accomplished shipbuilder, taught him, times have changed. He quickly gets blindsided by local building codes and bureaucratic officials. Hauled into court and facing jail, Craig takes a final stance against all odds in a truly inspirational story.']
